channel.title: Met Éireann Warnings
channel.description: Warnings issued by Met Éireann. This RSS feed displays valid warnings for land areas only. Sea area warnings will be added at a later date. Clicking the links, loads the CAP (Common Alerting Protocol) XML file. Note: Moderate means ‘Status Yellow’, Severe means ‘Status Orange’ and extreme means ‘Status Red’

item.title: Small Craft warning from Roche's Point to Bloody Foreland to Wicklow Head
item.description: West to northwest winds, backing southwest, will reach force 6 or higher.
item.author: forecasts@met.ie (Met Éireann)

item.title: Small Craft warning for all coasts of Ireland
item.description: Southwest to west winds, veering northwest, will reach force 6 or higher.
item.author: forecasts@met.ie (Met Éireann)

item.title: Small Craft warning for all coasts of Ireland
item.description: Northwest winds will reach force 6 or higher.
item.author: forecasts@met.ie (Met Éireann)

item.title: Low Temperature/Ice warning for Leinster, Cavan, Monaghan, Munster, Galway, Roscommon
item.description:
Temperatures falling to between -1 and -3 degrees generally. Sharp frost and icy stretches. Black ice too.
Impacts:
Treacherous travel conditions
item.author: forecasts@met.ie (Met Éireann)

item.title: Snow-Ice warning for Donegal, Leitrim, Mayo, Sligo
item.description:
Wintry showers with sleet and some snow accumulations. Sharp frost and ice also.
Impacts:
Hazardous Travel conditions Poor visibility
item.author: forecasts@met.ie (Met Éireann)
